CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1952, page 2, reads: "Harriman Search for Local Delegates - W. Averell Harriman, Mutual Security Administrator and aspirant for the Democratic nomination for President, lunched with Pittsburgh district labor and political leaders last week just prior to going to the convention where the nomination will be made this week. Shown at the speaker's table, left to right, County Commissioner John J. Kane, Anthony J. Federoff, CIO; Pittsburgh Central Labor Union President John A. Fiegel, Mayor David L. Lawrence, W. Averell Harriman, David J. McDonald, secretary-treasurer of the United Steelworkers; the Rev. Charles Owen Rice, and Atty. Richard F. Jones, president of the local branch of the NAACP. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Men seated at banquet table, including left to right: County Commissioner John J. Kane, CIO Anthony J. Federoff, Pittsburgh Central Labor Union President John A. Fiegel, Mayor David L. Lawrence, W. Averell Harriman, secretary-treasurer of the United Steelworkers David J. McDonald, Rev. Charles Owen Rice, and president of the local branch of the NAACP Attorney Richard F. Jones, gathered in interior with KDKA microphone, and downtown buildings visible through window
